title: Newton's Second Law
content: What is the acceleration of a 5 kg object when a force of 10 N is applied to it?
explanation: Using Newton's Second Law: a = F/m = 10/5 = 2 m/s²
subject: physics

title: Quadratic Equation
options: x = 2 and x = 3, x = -2 and x = -3, x = 2 and x = -3, x = -2 and x = 3
explanation: Using the quadratic formula or factoring: x² - 5x + 6 = 0 => (x - 2)(x - 3) = 0 => x = 2 or x = 3
subject: math

title: Periodic Table
content: Which element has the highest electronegativity in the periodic table?
explanation: Fluorine has the highest electronegativity value (3.98 on the Pauling scale) of all elements in the periodic table.
subject: chemistry

title: Projectile Motion
content: A ball is thrown horizontally from a height of 20m with an initial velocity of 15 m/s. How far from the base of the building will the ball hit the ground? (g = 10 m/s²)
explanation: Time to hit ground: t = √(2h/g) = √(2×20/10) = 2s. Horizontal distance = initial velocity × time = 15 × 2 = 30m
subject: physics

title: Cell Division
content: Which of the following is NOT a phase of mitosis?
explanation: Interphase is not a phase of mitosis. It's the period between cell divisions when the cell is preparing for division.
subject: biology

title: Organic Chemistry
content: What is the IUPAC name of CH₃-CH₂-CHO?
explanation: The compound CH₃-CH₂-CHO has an aldehyde group (-CHO) at the end of a three-carbon chain, making it propanal.
subject: chemistry

title: Electromagnetic Induction
content: According to Faraday's law of electromagnetic induction
options: the induced EMF is proportional to:
correct_answer: Rate of change of current, Rate of change of magnetic flux, Rate of change of electric field, Rate of change of resistance
subject: Faraday's law states that the induced EMF is proportional to the rate of change of magnetic flux through the circuit.

title: Chemical Bonding
content: Which type of bond is formed between two non-metal atoms with similar electronegativity values?
options: Ionic bond, Covalent bond, Metallic bond, Hydrogen bond
explanation: When two non-metals with similar electronegativity share electrons, they form a covalent bond.
subject: chemistry

title: Quantum Mechanics
content: What is the de Broglie wavelength of an electron (mass = 9.1 × 10⁻³¹ kg) moving at 10% of the speed of light? (h = 6.63 × 10⁻³⁴ J·s
subject: Using λ = h/mv where v = 0.1c: λ = (6.63 × 10⁻³⁴)/(9.1 × 10⁻³¹ × 0.1 × 3 × 10⁸) = 2.43 × 10⁻¹¹ m
